intro: Calamintha barolesii, commonly known as mountain thyme, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 centimeters, with small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are fragrant and often used in herbal teas and culinary applications. Calamintha barolesii thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy addition to rock gardens and alpine landscapes.
